repnme.cdata!:
Angola - Lobito / Benguela Urban
            Environmental Rehabilitation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Lobito/Benguela Urban Environmental
            Rehabilitation Project achieved most of its major objectives
            satisfactorily - improving public health and halting
            environmental degradation. The project reached a large
            portion of the entire population of Lobito-Benguela, despite
            the unanticipated large population increases due to the war,
            and the institutional strengthening and policy changes had a
            positive impact on the local service delivery and on the
            national water supply and sanitation sector. This report has
            identified some key lessons for the future design and
            implementation of projects: a) In terms of project design,
            before any financing is provided to a utility for physical
            investments, the institutional capacity should be evaluated
            to determine its ability to manage and operate the proposed
            investments. b) In terms of project implementation,
            decentralized projects require an adequate mechanism for
            communication among the implementing agencies, the Central
            Government, and IDA. c) Local staff should assume
            responsibility for the implementation of the project when
            technical assistance is provided to a project management or
            coordination unit, and transfer of knowledge to the local
            staff should take precedence over speed of execution.

repnme.cdata!:
Angola - Lobito Benguela Urban
            Environmental Rehabilitation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project consists of the following
            components : (a) environmental sanitation which comprises
            the rehabilitation and expansion of the water supply
            distribution and sanitary sewer systems; the rehabilitation
            of the solid waste management system; and the rehabilitation
            of the storm drainage and erosion control network; (b) low
            income sanitation which provides clean urban water to all
            unplanned settlements via a network of 500 standpipes and
            laundry facilities; a massive improved latrine and sanitary
            environmental education program; and a modest urban
            revegetation program; (c) institutional development which
            consists of technical assistance and training, and
            logistical and administrative support for the Provincial
            Water Company; for the Provincial Community Services
            Department; and for the Provincial Planning Office to manage
            and monitor the project as a whole; and lastly, (d) studies
            which assist the Government to reorganize the Provincial
            Water Company; set economic water and sewer tariffs; define
            policy issues and action plans for environmental management.

Angola - Lobito Benguela Urban Environmental
